Super jeu avec un bon scÃ©nario + un bon gameplay, c'est rare, merci les dÃ©v !
I LOVE THIS GAME! I'm in the middle of my 3rd playthrough, and I am having a BLAST.
It's not just a fps game. it is also a great game with its story and atmosphere. Besides being immersive, the steampunk world is wonderfully handled. You should play it. One last word; Booker, Catch!

A great game and an amazing story.

This game is has mindf*ck stories, its good old days when i'm first time played this game in middle school, and  now this stories still amaze me with game play graphics, good job Bioshock thanks to fill my childhood
Muy buena trama, buena jugabilidad. Eso sÃ­, corto: con las dos expansiones 25 horas y a partir de aquÃ­ sÃ³lo queda repeler oleadas.
Love the game as wonderful as it was when i had first played, just buy it lol

Different than its predecessors, (and frickin' HECK'o a lot easier) but, it's definitely still good.  
 ....More like playing a part in a movie whence you do not know the ending and your choices are already in the script. 

*
-=( If u'r an old bio shock fan(or just really good at fps games), PLay this on hard, unless you're gonna have a fried drumstick in one of your hands at ALL times.)=-   *

The minute i started to play this game i did not realize how special this game would be. I have never played the other Bioshock games but this game is amazing! I could play it over and over again and never get tired of it.

This game is offers great visuals, gameplay, music and story. Added to that mix, great environment that really captures an utopia in the sky with unseen corruption underlying it. Its gameplay is really fun and its replayable just to see what different strategies you can use with your abilities or to play it on harder modes. Btw, just buy the whole DLC bundle together if there is a promotion, its worth it. 
I rate it 9/11, pretty pog.

This is what it looks like when the devs put time and effort into making a game. I could honestly tell you I can sit here for an hour and I wouldn't be able to come up with a single thing I dislike about this game besides the fact that it ends. Now leave me be while I replay it again.

20/10
Es una obra maestra, los dlc valen tanto la pena como la historia principal.

Rating: 9/10

This game is a masterpiece and manages to feel like bioshock and also feel completely new and fresh. in my opinion is the best bioshock game in the series as I feel the story outshines the other 2 games. This game has a beautifully crafted story and the story has many twists and has a shocking ending. The graphics are beautiful despite the age of the game and it holds up really well, I also recommend the DLC, mainly (burial at sea) episode 1 & 2 as they add a lot of lore and they make connections between bioshock 1,2 and Infinite

Overall, this game is amazing and I rate this game a 9/10 and I 100% recommend this game, however if you haven't already played bioshock 1 and 2, I recommend that you do so before playing bioshock infinite and the DLC.
super fun game I have finaly beaten the game and there's tons more to do

Bioshock Infinite is really atmospheric game with interesting plot that drag you in more and more as you go through it and some confuzing and shocking in some way ending.
If tripping to time and other paradoxes is your thing, this game is for you

Let's start off this review by saying SPOILERS will be in this review. If you want to play the game without spoilers do not look at this review at all.

Main Game:
When walking through the gates of columbia for the first time I didn't know what to expect. It was a very beautiful sight to a game i've wanted to play since it came out but was either too young or just forgot or just didn't care it existed until I bought the collection. The main game was smooth I had no problems with it, the enemies are balanced(I played it on medium) and was very fun to get used to it and see every new and old mechanic in the game. The ending of the game was..confusing for most people but I understood it bc I've watched plenty of videos and read reviews prior to even playing. it didn't ruin my experience as I nearly cried at the main game's ending.
Burial at sea dlc 1:
Ohhh boy this dlc was pretty incredible, you start off in the office and see elizabeth come in. My first thoughts were "Hey is this another universe or something..?" throughout the game it was clear to me that it really wasn't. Elizabeth's comments throughout the game were evidence to it being the one I saw and loved fighting along side with during my main story adventure. Then we have the ending...I must say I actually didn't expect that at all. But with you playing as comstock the entire time and Elizabeth wanting you to KNOW it you know she meant business. I usually love playing as the main character and want them to live, don't get me wrong at all I loved playing as comstock in the dlc but seeing and hearing Comstock say "Child" to Elizabeth at the ending was just..made me want him to perish, with one single word you can tell he wasn't sorry at all...that the same man in any universe is the same man and that he never changed at all.
Burial at sea dlc 2:
We continue off from dlc 1 in paris, I saw many references to the letuce in it and how things went from peppy  loving and like Elizabeth's dream impression of paris it quickly turned dark and sour and gloomy. The first thing I noticed was that Elizabeth, throughout the game, can climb things. Like the rubble at the start or the vents. What I did notice is she climbs them like a little sister, like the end game shows constants and variables,  the thing I loved most about this dlc? The stealth. You didn't HAVE to kill anybody and so I didn't (Excluding turrets bc sometimes it's easier to possess a turret and let it shoot the room up than sneaking past everyone) people usually complained about the "13 minute introduction where there's no gameplay" but I actually WANTED that to happen. I loved it plain and simple, I wished dlc 1 had more of it..more of rapture and the lives of the people in it. And dlc 2 had more story to show, the walking sections made me examine everything I could and listen. I loved it..now the ending..ohh boy the ending. The ending made me cry. Bioshock 2's good ending made me sob and years later when I even knew the ending and what would happen I still cried...this game is perfect in my book and DESERVES all little bit of praise it gets. Thank you irrational games for making this master piece of a game and thank you to everyone reading. If you have any thoughts or would like to correct me on anything I said I left comments open..thank you again for this masterpiece and reading.
Trotz seines Alters ein optisch wirklich hÃ¼bscher Shooter. Das Storytelling ist wirklich gut und wahnsinnig intensiv. Ich kann diese Perle unter den Shootern nur jedem empfehlen. =)

Loved every second of the story, i can tell how much work they put into it and was kinda confused with the end, but confused in a way that gave me interest because last time i played the other bioshock games where on console years ago.
Very fun adventure narrative, still good despite coming out in 2013
good story, awful game... just go watch some walkthrough

10/10.
Forever one of my favorite franchises.
O jogo Ã© sensacional, quem gostou dos anteriores vai amar esse, apenas joguem.
The story is great. The characters are great. The action is great. Everything about this game is great. It's a piece of art that should be in everyone's collection.

El mejor Bioshock de la saga este juego es una locura, tiene una historia increible, Nuevas armas, Nueva estetica (Osea nueva cuidad con habitantes y nuevos enemigos), Buen gameplay, pero lo mejor de todo es la historia tenes que comprarlo si o si. Tambien el DLC que trae llamado Burial at sea es increible por que nos explica mas cosas de el primer bioshock y cerrando con toda la historia de los personajes. 10/10
